text:
Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments ARSENAL striker Lucas Perez looks set to leave the Emirates after his agent claimed: He wants to go. 
The Spanish forward, 28, has been limited to just ten Premier League appearances all season – mostly as a substitute – under Arsene Wenger in his debut year. Reuters 3 Lucas Perez has already had enough of life at Arsenal having been frozen out 
With Perez aiming to break into the Spain squad for the 2018 World Cup, he is in desperate need of first-team football. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Arsenal news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary. 
However, as the player’s talks with boss Wenger seem to have borne no fruit , agent Rodrigo Fernandez Llovelle told Calciomercato: “He hasn’t received any offer yet. 
“If Lucas leaves London – and he will leave because he’s had no chance with [Arsene] Wenger – he wants to go and play for a big club like Arsenal. Lucas Perez scores an amazing volley for Arsenal against Bournemouth EPA 3 Lucas Perez is hoping to break into the Spain set-up for the 2018 World Cup 
“Milan is a great club and he likes them very much, even if we’ve never talked with the Rossoneri hierarchy. 
“Look, the truth is that Lucas wants to leave at all costs and is not happy at Arsenal, he hasn’t settled and hasn’t had a chance to play and show what he can do. 
“No matter who is the manager in the future, we want to go. The player must have the chance to play.” Arsenal new boy Lucas Perez smashes in an absolute beauty of a volley from a corner Reuters 3 Lucas Perez has netted just one goal in the Premier League this season 
Perez would have been hoping his fortunes would change when he scored a Champions League hat-trick in the 4-1 win away to Basel in December. 
But the Spaniard has started just three matches since then and now finds himself behind Alexis Sanchez, Olivier Giroud and the fit-again Danny Welbeck in the striker pecking order. 
Perez has only started in two Premier League games since his arrival, scoring just once.
